roleset.name: change form

example.name: evolve-v: end state only
example.text: Pitney Bowes acquired the core of what *trace* evolved into Wheeler Group in 1979 by buying Dictaphone Corp.

example.name: ARG1 and ARG3 and ARG2
example.text: Through 25 years of development , Xiamen Special Economic Zone has evolved from the previously isolated coastal defense outpost to a frontline of reform and opening - up .

propbank.arg: from the previously isolated coastal defense outpost
to a frontline of reform and opening - up

example.name: evolution-n: arg1
example.text: They have taken individualism to a degree that it goes against the evolution of one of the most social animals in the world , the human being .

propbank.arg: of one of the most social animals in the world , the human being

example.name: evolution-n: all args
example.text: Concept of the Buddha , Its evolution from early Buddhism to the trikaya theory .

roleset.note: EVOLVE-V NOTES: The framing for the related verbs 'develop' 'grow' and 'change' arewildly dissimilar. Yuck. (from evolve.01-v)
EVOLUTION-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, evolve.01. Corresponds to VNcls grow-26.2, appear-48.1.1 (from evolution.01-n)

roleset.name: acquire characteristics through evolution

example.name: evolve-v: darwin was right!
example.text: These trade - offs would evolve priorities by revealing when the cost of the B-2 became prohibitive .

propbank.arg: by revealing when the cost of the B-2 became prohibitive

example.name: evolve-v: With scientist as ArgA, secondary agent
example.text: At age fourteen , Dan was learning to evolve RNA molecules to bind arbitrary ligands .

example.name: evolution-n: args 1 and 2
example.text: Furthermore , by means of the perturbative calculation , the non - locality and its evolution of two kinds of entangled coherent states in a thermal reservoir are discussed .

propbank.arg: of two kinds of entangled coherent states in a thermal reservoir

roleset.note: EVOLVE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'evolve' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Verbnet class grow-26.2, other framed members include 'develop' and 'grow'. Comparison with 'change'. (from evolve.02-v predicate notes)
EVOLUTION-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on evolve.02. Corresponds to VNcls appear-48.1.1. (from evolution.02-n)

args moved up by one so that argA in the verb frame is Arg0 here, and so on. The entity undergoing the evolutionary change should not by nature be agentive, which makes it a poor candidate for arg0. (from evolution.02-n)
